reviewText:
Very interested in the tech here, but the performance on my GTX 970 is just abysmal.  Anytime I look at a character (especially in boxing), my PC goes into constant reprojection (45 fps).  It even sometimes can't keep up with reprojection and drops frames even then.

Anything you can do to lower the poly count of the captures models?  I understand you're using ray-traced data, but my card simply can't keep up.

Fix the performance issues, add some additional characters and content, and I'll definitely reconsider!
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This is another one of those things where it's not so much a game as much as it is a tech demo for volumetric 3D filming, which is sort of like photogrammetry but for people by my limited understanding. It's not bad, but it's also not really that great, and the characters tend to have minor graphical glitches and white borders that make the scenes look more like you're living in one of those old FMV-based point-and-click adventures instead of a real world. It's free, so if you're curious you may as well try it, but it's a pretty big download so it's hard to say if it's worth the time to download it, depending on how interested you are in the technology and seeing a glimpse of something that might be more worthwhile in the future. I'm only rating it positive because there's no neutral option and I'd feel bad if I gave it a thumbs down.

reviewText:

reviewText:
Update to my review..
The developers fixed the bug with the control pad and keyboard so i got to try it this time ..
Not sure what to say so start with good..

Its a nice concept of having real people placed in cgi enviroments with you being able to walk round them in virtual reality plus i know the gladiator scene is cheesy but the actor made me laugh as i thought it was funny kinda like a scene from Bill and Ted.. And this is free

Some bad points..

The models up close are very low res and are some of the textures especially on the mountain and the greenscreen for the actors was a little bad and very bad for the mountain scene as times part of the guy was going crazy..
Now if this was a first time this had been tried id be alot more forgiven but ive seen stuff like this done before like for the film Insidious and that was amazing...

In a nutshell its not bad and its free so its worth a try especially if you having experienced something like this in vr before but if you have you will be dissapointed with this.. Finally this maybe a new company/developer trying something new and for that i give them credit and hope they continue becouse this stuff has potential so with all that said i would recommend this
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
It is a interesting demo, but in its current state using point clouds to make the 3d objects the disk usage is absolutely massive. There must be a way to average out the point cloud data to really cut down on the space used.

As well it is always good to put in the ability to control a demo with things that you know all users will have like a keyboard and mouse in worst case scenario. Just my opinion but people will get frustrated if they cannot use the menu because of your hardware support choices.

As it stands it is a interesting tech demo although in its current state I am not sure what it would be used for. I cannot really imagine using it in lot of games and a solid model would work just as well and be easier to work with. And the file size would cripple it for larger videos. I imagine if they can get the data size required on the users computer down this could be interesting.

Download this just for curiousity there is not a lot here.

reviewText:
Interesting concept, and it's free, so you can't really go wrong by trying it.

However, it's a huge download.  And when you get it, it's mostly some *very* cheesy actors with some interesting scanning that looks like multiple Kinect devices were used, but the overall effect isn't that good.  At all.

It's also worth noting that this is pretty CPU heavy.  I have an i5-4670k and a 980Ti and it stutters like a champ in places.

It's an interesting point-of-concept, but honestly I think you get a better understanding of what a good narrative could be by watching The Rose and I or The Diveregent Series (although the actors are equally cheesy!)
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: This is a fantastic tech demo that really shows the future of media VR. I'm pretty disappointed this is getting low reviews as I think people are failing to appreciate what sets this apart from most other media in VR right now. 3D captured live performances in an impressive feat that will absolutely blow 360 videos away in the future. This may be a little blurry and rough around the edges now but it is a clear path to the awesome things we can expect in the future of VR. Well done.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Pretty awesome rendering of motion-captured people. This is just a tech demo, but if you're interested in computer graphics it's worth checking out. There's no gameplay - just a few minutes of character animation and dialogue.

Most other reviews mention the performance. It's worth noting that the performance is fine in the first 2 out of 4 demos - only the last 2 demos have issues. Thankfully the most interesting characters are in the 2 demos that have good performance.
